    private void
    updateBoardLegalMoves()
    This method works on the principle that the only possible pieces that could possibly change their legal moves besides the moved piece are those that immediately border the location the moved piece initially was, the location the moved piece moved to, and the location of the piece that was taken, if one was.

      input - : The saved game
      player1 - : The name of player 1
      player2 - : The name of player 2

  • Method Details

    • setUpDefault

      private void setUpDefault(String player1, String player2)
      Sets up a default board. You know what a checkers game looks like. It's that
      Parameters:
      player1 - : The name of player 1
      player2 - : The name of player 2

    • setUpDefaultBoardState

      private void setUpDefaultBoardState()
      Sets all the values in the board to 0 except where the pieces should be on a default starting checkers board, whic are set to 1 for player 1 pieces and -1 for player 2 pieces respectively.

    • addPiece

      private void addPiece(int rowNum, int colNum, boolean pieceIsOwnedByPlayerOne)
      adds a piece to the board and initialize all its legal moves from there, which is then added to that player's map of legal moves.
      Parameters:
      rowNum - : The row value this piece should be placed in.
      colNum - : The column value this piece should be placed in.
      pieceIsOwnedByPlayerOne - : A boolean determining which player owns the piece being added.

    • addPieceToLegalCaptures

      private void addPieceToLegalCaptures(int sourceRow, int sourceCol, int targetRow, int targetColumn, boolean pieceIsOwnedByPlayerOne)
      Adds a piece move to the map of legal captures for the player that owns the piece. Legal captures take priority over other moves, so it needs to be computed distinctly
      Parameters:
      sourceRow - : The row the piece started in.
      sourceCol - : The column the piece started in.
      targetRow - : The row of the piece being taken
      targetColumn - : The column of the piece being taken.
      pieceIsOwnedByPlayerOne - : A boolean determining which player is taking the piece

    • getLegalMovesForPiece

      private int[][] getLegalMovesForPiece(int row, int col, boolean inputCameFromPlayer1)
      Computes the legal moves for a given piece.
      Parameters:
      row - : the row location of the piece.
      col - : the column location of the piece.
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : A boolean determining which player owns the piece. Technically unnecessary but I like it.
      Returns:
      A 2d array of size [4][2], representing all the possible legal moves a piece can perform. Since arrays are fixed size, if a piece has only invalid input: '<'=3 moves, then some of the arrays of size two will look like [-1, -1] to represent a null pointer.

    • checkValidJump

      private int[] checkValidJump(int rowNum, int colNum, boolean inputCameFromPlayer1, int scalar, int leftRightScalar, int upDownScalar)
      Checks whether a move is legal or not. This method is annoying to read, so here is the criteria: 1) If the location is out of bounds, return the null array 2) If the location is free, return that index since it's a valid move 3) If the location contains the player's piece, return the null array 4) If the location contains the opponent's piece, check the piece after it. If it is empty, return that index and add the move to legal jumps. If it is not empty, regardless of the kind of piece, return the null array.
      Parameters:
      rowNum - : The row of the piece whose valid moves are being checked
      colNum - : The column of the piece whose valid moves are being checked
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : A boolean determining which player owns the piece. Not necessary, but helpful.
      scalar - : Either 1 or -1 depending on if you're player 1 or player 2, since they move up and down the board.
      leftRightScalar - : Either 1 or -1 depending on whether the move the method is testing for goes right or left.
      upDownScalar - : Either 1 or -1 depending on whether the move the method is testing for goes up or down. Only applicable for promoted pieces
      Returns:
      The location of the valid move or the null array.

    • takeInput

      public void takeInput(int xPos, int yPos)
      Take input from the user and pass it along to be processed.
      Parameters:
      xPos - : The x position on the board the player clicked
      yPos - : The y position on the board the player clicked

    • processInput

      private void processInput(int xPos, int yPos, HashMap<ArrayList<Integer>,ArrayList<int[]>> legalCaptures)
      Processes the input, determining if it is legal, if it is clicking a piece, if it is telling where to move a piece, or is it does absolutely nothing. It also handles repeated jumping.
      Parameters:
      xPos - : The x position on the board the player clicked
      yPos - : The y position on the board the player clicked
      legalCaptures - : The map of legal captures the player making the input has

    • computeLegalMovesForPiece

      private void computeLegalMovesForPiece(int rowNum, int colNum, boolean inputCameFromPlayer1, HashMap<ArrayList<Integer>,ArrayList<int[]>> legalCaptures)
      Computes the legal moves a piece can have when filtered by the legal captures map
      Parameters:
      rowNum - : The row value of the input
      colNum - : The col value of the input
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : which player is doing the input
      legalCaptures - : A map showing all legal captures.

    • filterLegalMoves

      private void filterLegalMoves(ArrayList<Integer> selectedKey, HashMap<ArrayList<Integer>,ArrayList<int[]>> legalCaptures)
      This method's annoying so here's rundown: 1) If legalCaptures is empty, then no filtering is needed. 2) If legalCaptures is not empty, check if our piece is one of the captures. If it is, then keep it. If not, replace it with the null array.
      Parameters:
      selectedKey - : The row/col position being filtered.
      legalCaptures - : The map of captures acting as a filter.

    • swapPlayer

      private void swapPlayer()
      Swaps the player

    • isOwnedPiece

      private boolean isOwnedPiece(int rowNum, int colNum, boolean inputCameFromPlayer1)
      Returns whether the grid element at index rowNum/colNum contains a piece that is owned by the player taking the input.
      Parameters:
      rowNum - : The row value of the input
      colNum - : The col value of the input
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : which player is doing the input
      Returns:
      whether the piece at that square is owned by the player giving input

    • isLegalMoveForSelectedPiece

      private boolean isLegalMoveForSelectedPiece(int rowNum, int colNum, boolean inputCameFromPlayer1)
      Returns whether the grid element at index rowNum/colNum contains a valid location for the piece currently selected to move to, as well as the input coming from the user who owns the square being selected.
      Parameters:
      rowNum - : The row value of the input
      colNum - : The col value of the input
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : which player is doing the input
      Returns:
      whether the piece is a legal move for the piece in terms of the board values.

    • clearSelectedPossibleMoves

      private void clearSelectedPossibleMoves()
      Erases all legal move markers, which are values of 3/-3, on the map, and sets all arrays in selectedLegalMoves to the null array.

    • isPieceControlledByAlly

      private boolean isPieceControlledByAlly(int pieceScore, boolean inputCameFromPlayer1)
      Checks if the piece is controlled by the player giving input
      Parameters:
      pieceScore - : the value of the piece
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : the player giving input
      Returns:
      whether the piece is controlled by the player giving input

    • setSelectedPotentialMovesToCorrectScore

      private void setSelectedPotentialMovesToCorrectScore(boolean inputCameFromPlayer1)
      Set the score of the potential moves for the selected piece to be 3 or -3 depending on the player who gave the input.
      Parameters:
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : The player giving the input

    • moveSelected

      public boolean moveSelected(int rowNum, int colNum, boolean inputCameFromPlayer1)

      Parameters:
      rowNum - : The row value of the input
      colNum - : The col value of the input
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : which player is doing the input

      colNum - : The col value of the input
      inputCameFromPlayer1 - : which player is doing the input

    • updateBoardLegalMoves

      private void updateBoardLegalMoves()
      This method works on the principle that the only possible pieces that could possibly change their legal moves besides the moved piece are those that immediately border the location the moved piece initially was, the location the moved piece moved to, and the location of the piece that was taken, if one was.

    • resetMovedAndSelected

      private void resetMovedAndSelected()
      Resets the movedIndex and selectedIndex fields.

    • clearSelectedCaptures

      private void clearSelectedCaptures()
      Clears the selected captures maps for player 1 and player 2.

    • removeNonMovedPieceLegalCaptures

      private void removeNonMovedPieceLegalCaptures()
      Remove all legal captures that don't come from the piece that was being moved, which basically prevents any other moves from occuring besides the chain capturing.

    • pieceCanCaptureAnother

      private boolean pieceCanCaptureAnother()
      Checks whether the piece at movedIndex can capture another piece
